intro: Elatostema ramosum var. villosum, commonly known as the hairy elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a velvety appearance. The plant produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that are typically borne on short pedicels. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments. The leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties.
